sources.full: Spicy Spook: Circle of the Guardian

subclassFeature.name: Circle of the Guardian
entries: Druids are worshippers of nature, able to weave its primeval power into mighty spells that bend the elements of the natural world to their will and transform into all manner of beasts. There are some druids however who see a different path to that power. Instead of transforming into beasts, they choose to embody the steadfast strength of the forest, the interconnected web of life that shields its inhabitants, and the ever nurturing boons of its fruits, channeling their druidic power to embody those aspects. Those within the Circle of the Guardian, also known as greenkeepers or emerald knights, literally cloak themselves in nature itself, becoming mighty bulwarks and protectors of all living things.

subclassFeature.name: Verdant Warrior
entries: When you join this circle at 2nd level, your efforts to become a druidic warrior have borne fruit. You gain proficiency with martial weapons.
You also gain proficiency in the {@skill Athletics} skill if you do not already have it.

subclassFeature.name: Guardian Form
entries: At 2nd level, you can channel an ancient druidic magic, cloaking yourself in the elements of nature around you and adopting your Guardian Form. As a bonus action, you can expend one use of your Wild Shape feature to assume your Guardian Form, rather than transforming into a beast.

This protective form tends to resemble whatever natural elements it is formed out of; be it hard tree bark and thick vines in a forested area, jagged ice and frozen rock in a boreal environment or a shell of hardened sand and sun-bleached stone in a desert. Ultimately, you determine the form's appearance.
While your Guardian Form is active, you gain the following benefits:

items: You gain a bonus to your AC equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of +1).
You have advantage on Strength ({@skill Athletics}) checks.
Moving through non-magical difficult terrain costs you no extra movement.
When you attack with a weapon, you can add your Wisdom modifier, instead of Strength or Dexterity, to the attack and damage rolls.

entries: The form lasts for 10 minutes. It ends early if you dismiss it (no action required), are {@condition incapacitated}, die, or use this feature again.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: Starting at 6th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn. Moreover, you can cast one of your cantrips in place of one of those attacks.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Avatar
entries: When you reach 10th level in this class, you are able to infuse the elements of nature into your protective form and weapons to become a bastion of elemental might. When you activate your Guardian Form, choose one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, lightning or poison. While your Guardian Form is active, you gain resistance to that damage type and when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you deal an additional {@damage 1d6} damage of the chosen damage type.

subclassFeature.name: Bulwark of Nature
entries: At 14th level, your Guardian Form shields you even further against the physical threats of the world, giving you resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage while the form is active.
